de.dezibel.gui

Class DezibelPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • de.dezibel.gui.DezibelPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class DezibelPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This is the main class of our UI. It uses a docking library, called "Sanaware Javadocking", for dragable panels. It uses five areas where panels can be docked to. Top,Right,Bottom, Left and Center. When a panel is docked, it shows a minimum of information, like the playerpanel shows only the controls for the music. If it is docked to the center there will be displayed a playlist.
    Author:
    Pascal, Tobias, Richard
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DezibelPanel

        public DezibelPanel(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        Constructor of the panel
        Parameters:
        frame - Frame that contains the panel.

    • Method Detail

      • showLogin

        public void showLogin()
        Shows the login-panel docked in the center with no other panels on the frame Any panel docked in the center will be removed.

      • showRegistration

        public void showRegistration()
        Shows the registration-panel docked in the center with no other panels on the frame Any panel docked in the center will be removed.

      • showWorkspace

        public void showWorkspace()
        Creates the typical workspace, with sidebards on the right and left, the player-panel docked at the bottom, or at its last position and a profil-panel at the center. And a beautiful menubar, a.k.a toolbar.

      • showProfile

        public void showProfile(User user)
        Shows the profil-panel, with the content of user in the center. Every panel at the center will be removed from the centerdock.
        Parameters:
        user -

      • showProfile

        public void showProfile(Label label)

      • showPlaylist

        public void showPlaylist(Playlist list)
        Shows the playlist given by list in a PlaylistPanel at the center.
        Parameters:
        list - The playlist the user wants to receive more information.

      • showSearch

        public void showSearch()
        Show the search at the center.

      • showAlbum

        public void showAlbum(Album album)
        Shows the albumpanel at the center. See showPlaylist for more details.
        Parameters:
        album - The album the user wants to receive more information from.

      • showNews

        public void showNews(News n)
        Shows the newspanel at the center, where the user can see all news from his favorised users/labels.
        Parameters:
        n - The news given by n will be selected and details will be displayed.

      • refresh

        public void refresh(UpdateEntity ue)
        This function is called from any child-panel if its content changes and other panels have to display the same content.
        Parameters:
        ue - A constant of which change was made.

      • createAndShowGUI

        public static void createAndShowGUI()
        This function is only called in the main-function and only once. It creates a JFrame with a DezibelPanel and some docking-features.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main-Function, it creates a the typical UI
        Parameters:
        args - startup-arguments (will be ignored!)

      • createDocking

        private void createDocking()
        Creates the typical docking-behavior for each panel. Any panel is placed in a Dockable and the dockmodel for DezibelPanel is set to FloatDockModel.

      • addActions

        private com.javadocking.dockable.Dockable addActions(com.javadocking.dockable.Dockable dockable)
        Adds the action to a dockable given as parameter. The dockable has the default behaviour
        Parameters:
        dockable - the dockable where the actions should be added
        Returns:
        a new dockable with the actions, based on the object given as parameter

      • addActionsWithCloseExt

        private com.javadocking.dockable.Dockable addActionsWithCloseExt(com.javadocking.dockable.Dockable dockable)
        See addActions for more details. Actions will be the normal behavior, close, minimize and externalize.
        Parameters:
        dockable - the dockable where the actions should be added
        Returns:
        a new dockable with the actions, based on the object given as parameter

      • addSideCenterListener

        private void addSideCenterListener()
        Adds a listener to the side-panels, which can be docked at center,left and right. If a dockable is docked to the center, onCenter is called from DragablePanel, else onLeftRight

      • addTopBottomCenterListener

        private void addTopBottomCenterListener()
        Same as addSideCenterListener, but for Top,Bottom and Center

      • showSidebars

        private void showSidebars()
        Shows the typical sidebars with MyList, Favorites, News and Ads. Is only called once, after the login-process when the typical workspace will be created

      • showSidebar

        private void showSidebar(com.javadocking.dockable.Dockable bar)
        Docks the specific dockable to the left or right sidebar, depending on which has a lower dockable count. bar shouldbe one of daMyLists, daNews, daFavorites, daAds
        Parameters:
        bar - the new Dockable which will be docked at the left or right

      • createMenubar

        private void createMenubar()
        Creates the typical menubar with icons

      • removeMenubar

        private void removeMenubar()
        Removes the menubar from the frame. Needed for logout.

      • showAtCenter

        private void showAtCenter(com.javadocking.dockable.Dockable da)
        Shows the dockable give by da at the center. If the centerdock has already a dockable it will be removed. If there is a empty childdock, like linedock it will be removed.
        Parameters:
        da - The dockable that should be displayed at the center.

      • clearCenter

        private void clearCenter(com.javadocking.dockable.Dockable newDa)
        Just like clearCenter
        Parameters:
        newDa - If the newDa is an instance of PlaylistPanel the refresh method is called.

      • clearCenter

        public void clearCenter()
        Clear the centerdock from any dockable

      • onLogout

        private void onLogout()
        This function is called, if the user press the logout-button in the menubar.

      • onMenuCheckedSideBar

        private void onMenuCheckedSideBar(javax.swing.JCheckBoxMenuItem src,
                        com.javadocking.dockable.Dockable da)
        If the specific menuitem is selected the dockable will be displayed, otherwise it will be removed from the sidebar.
        Parameters:
        src - The menuitem for the dockable.
        da - The dockable to be added/removed from the sidebar.

      • onGoTo

        private void onGoTo(com.javadocking.dockable.Dockable da)
        Displays the specific dockable at the center.
        Parameters:
        da - dockable which should be displayed at the center.

      • onUpload

        private void onUpload()
        Shows a new UploadDialog to upload a new musicfile.

      • onGenre

        private void onGenre()
        Shows a new GenreDialog for editing the genre list. Can only be called, if the current user is the administrator.

      • onCreateNews

        private void onCreateNews()
        Shows a new NewsDialog for creating a new news. Can only be called, if the current user is an artist or labelmanager.

      • getFrame

        public javax.swing.JFrame getFrame()
        returns the frame, which has DezibelPanel as childpanel.
        Returns:
        The frame in wich Dezipelpanel is displayed

      • showMedium

        public void showMedium(Medium medium)
        Shows an instance of Mediumpanel at the center. The content of the panel is the information of the medium
        Parameters:
        medium - The medium the user wants to receive information.
